column4: Whenever I send or receive a message in Pidgin it freezes. It would seem that it is chilly outside and the carrier pidgins are too frozen to deliver anything.
did you install any plugins and/or have you updated your system recently
Kopete
I just installed Ubuntu in a VM, it has worked on all other operating systems I have used it on. And stop trying to convert me please.
I do tech support for a living man.... most people just want the simplest answer....
If someone is asking how to fix a bruise on a pear; telling them to eat a banana instead isn't going to solve their problem.
It does if they are really hungry
The only plugin I have enabled is Nautilus Integration, which was enabled by default so I didn't touch it. I did mess with the settings, but not too much.
Are you using multiple accounts currently? Sounds like ya are.
I have AOL, WL, Google, and Yahoo! accounts.

Ya might want to try disabling all accounts, signing into each one and if possible chat someone on each service up, to see what the response is like. Maybe one of the services is lagging and it's causing the whole program to slow down
I just tried that. It happens with all four services. Whenever I send or receive a message the whole program freezes.
Might try opening up Terminal and running pidgin from there.... send some messages and see if anything catches your eye there
Does Pidgin print anything in the terminal?
Lemme check a few things real quick like
All it returns is "killed" when I force it to quit.
you want to try `pidgin --debug` and prepare to see a screenfull
gstreamer: Failed to connect stream: Invalid argument
What does Pidgin use Gstreamer for?
No idea man
Well it makes sense, Ubuntu isn't picking up my VMs virtual soundcard.
If it's spitting out a *LOT* of messages about sound related stuff, then I would recommend addressing the sound card to actually resolve the issue
rww's got a point as well
I changed the soundcard for the VM and Pidgin works now, along with my sound to. =3
